author: Jim Wyss, Michelle Kaske
description: The Trump administration overstepped its authority when it fired members of Puerto Rico’s financial watchdog in August, the US District Court of Puerto Rico ruled.
title: Court Says Firing of Puerto Rico Oversight Members Was Unlawful

author: Myles Miller, Alicia A. Caldwell, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The Trump administration is preparing to launch a program that would offer money to unaccompanied migrant teenagers in federal custody in exchange for voluntarily returning to their home countries, according to the Department of Health and Human Services.
title: US to Offer Migrant Teenagers $2,500 to Voluntarily Return Home

author: Lisa Beyer
description: Under pressure from Arab leaders and the US, Hamas on Oct. 3 accepted one part of President Donald Trump’s proposed plan for settling the group’s two-year war with Israel. Hamas said it would release the hostages it still holds but withheld a decision on other aspects of the proposed 20-point settlement, which Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has accepted.
title: What Does Trump’s Gaza Peace Plan Promise?

author: Maggie Eastland
description: A coalition of business groups warned President Donald Trump that a newly announced $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications risks harming the US economy and urged the administration to avoid changes to the skilled worker program that impose added burdens on companies.
title: Trump’s $100,000 H-1B Fee Draws Rare Rebuke From Business Groups

author: Greg Stohr
description: A divided Supreme Court let the Trump administration strip more than 300,000 Venezuelans of the right to temporarily live and work in the US, in a decision that opens a new category of migrants to the prospect of arrest and deportation.
title: Supreme Court Lets Trump End Venezuelan Migrant Protections

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Hadriana Lowenkron delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Highlights Project 2025 Architect’s Role in Shutdown Cuts

author: Abeer Abu Omar, Fares Alghoul
description: Hamas agreed to release all Israeli hostages captured in its Oct. 7 attack but said the rest of President Donald Trump’s 20-point peace plan would be subject to negotiation.
title: Hamas Agrees to Release Hostages But Sets Conditions for Peace

author: Chris Dolmetsch, Zoe Tillman
description: A global nurse-staffing agency and several unions sued over President Donald Trump’s plans to charge a $100,000 fee for H-1B visas that allow skilled immigrants to work in the US, saying the move is unlawful.
title: Trump’s $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee Challenged by Nurse Group, Unions

author: Jonnelle Marte
description: Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said the US central bank is further away from its inflation target than it is from the maximum employment goal, and reiterated that officials should move cautiously with interest-rate reductions.
title: Fed’s Logan Signals Inflation Is Top Issue, Urges Rate Caution

author: William Standring, Siraj Datoo, Myles Miller
description: Jewish residents say successive governments allowed antisemitism to fester.
title: In Manchester, Prayers Turn to Anger After Attack on Synagogue

author: Vidya N Root
description: President Emmanuel Macron blamed Russia for the death on Friday of a French photojournalist, Antoni Lallican, in a drone attack while on assignment in Ukraine.
title: Macron Blames Russia for Death of a French Journalist in Ukraine

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: A new regulatory pilot project from the US Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services is under review at the White House budget office, suggesting that the Trump administration is seeking to take regulatory action against drugmakers even as it strikes deals with individual companies.
title: Trump Officials Plan to Test New Medicare Drug Pricing Rules

author: Courtney McBride
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said he directed a military strike on another vessel ferrying drugs from Venezuela, killing four, as the Trump administration presses ahead with a strategy to target narco-traffickers it calls unlawful combatants at war with the US.
title: US Military Strikes Another Alleged Drug Boat Off Venezuela

author: Alexandre Rajbhandari
description: The US Government Accountability Office is assessing the risks posed by private credit, in a sign that Washington is further scrutinizing the impact of the $1.7 trillion industry on the broader economy.
title: Private Credit Risks to Be Assessed by US Government Watchdog

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The White House is concerned that a prolonged government shutdown could further delay the release of key economic data the jobs report scheduled for Friday was held back.
title: White House Worries About Impact of Economic Data Delays

author: Katanga Johnson
description: US regulators are set to unveil a plan next week targeting how officials scrutinize banks’ risk, after President Donald Trump moved to rein in what he sees as the closing of customer accounts for political reasons.
title: FDIC Set to Jump Into Trump’s Debanking Fight With New Plan

author: Milda Seputyte
description: A growing public backlash over Lithuania’s week-old government led to the resignation of a cabinet minister as the country’s cultural community threatened fresh protests and warned about the erosion of democratic values.
title: Minister Resigns in Lithuania as Backlash Over Coalition Grows

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Michael J Kavanagh, Joe Deaux, William Clowes
description: A key element of the Trump administration’s peace deal between Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo has hit a hurdle after officials failed to agree on an economic pact because hostilities continue, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump-Touted Rwanda-Congo Economic Pact Trips on Elusive Peace

author: Nicolle Yapur, Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Argentine bonds have soared or tumbled on every headline that has peppered trading screens over the past two weeks in a frenzy of volatility. Some investors see local traders behind many of the moves as foreigners hold tight.
title: Locals Fuel Argentine Bond Volatility as Bessent Stokes Chaos

author: Kate O'Keeffe, Shawn Donnan, Josh Wingrove, Eric Martin, Jenny Leonard
description: China is pushing the Trump administration to roll back national-security restrictions on Chinese deals in the US, dangling the prospect of a massive investment package as part of a proposal that would upend a decade of policy.
title: China Pushes Trump to Drop Curbs as It Dangles Investment Pledge

author: Kristine Aquino, Joel Leon
description: The US government shutdown would have to last over a month for the bull run in US stocks to hit the brakes, the latest Markets Pulse survey showed.
title: US Stocks Can Weather Shutdown If Not Prolonged: Markets Pulse

author: Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Parliament is considering accelerating a phaseout of Russian oil and gas imports in a bid to sever ties definitively with the region’s former top energy supplier.
title: European Parliament Seeks Faster Phaseout of Russian Oil and Gas

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said he is setting a Sunday evening deadline for Hamas to agree to his plan to end the war in Gaza, warning of stark consequences if the group does not sign on to the proposal.
title: Trump Sets Sunday Night Deadline for Hamas to Back Gaza Plan

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: The health insurance subsidies at the center of the US government shutdown fight disproportionately benefit areas of the country represented by Republican lawmakers, posing a potential vulnerability for Donald Trump’s party in next year’s midterm congressional elections.
title: GOP Districts ‘Supercharged’ Obamacare Use Is Risk in Shutdown Fight

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court said it will take up a new gun-rights case, agreeing to review a Hawaii law that bars people from bringing handguns into stores and other private property without the owner’s permission.
title: Supreme Court Agrees to Hear New Gun Case Over Right to Carry

author: Jonathan Gilbert
description: Argentine President Javier Milei’s brief pause on crop export tariffs last week, implemented to shore up the nation’s finances, sparked the biggest wave of bookings on record. Commodity traders and farmers are now grappling with the fallout.
title: Milei’s 48-Hour Tariff Pause Spurs Record Surge in Crop Exports

author: Brian Platt
description: Mark Carney will head to the White House next Tuesday, his second visit as Canada’s prime minister, as officials from the two countries negotiate on trade and security issues.
title: Trump, Carney to Meet in Washington as Trade Fight Drags On

author: Lucy White
description: UK Green Party Leader Zack Polanski branded Israel’s actions in Gaza “genocide” and criticized Keir Starmer’s proscription of Palestine Action as an attack on freedom as he sought to challenge the UK prime minister’s Labour Party from the left.
title: UK Green Leader Slams Labour Over Gaza Protests and Migration

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court will consider making it easier to sue over Cuban property confiscated by Fidel Castro’s government in 1960, accepting two appeals with potentially billions of dollars in stakes for US companies.
title: Cuban Property Seizure Lawsuits Get US Supreme Court Review

author: Geoffrey Morgan
description: Fund managers in Canada are pushing their chips into sectors expected to benefit from Prime Minister Mark Carney’s plan to fast-track major infrastructure projects and become less reliant on trade with the US.
title: Canadian Funds Bet on ‘Nation-Building’ Amid US Tariffs, Taunts

author: Gregory Korte
description: The White House still employs 45 staffers for Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency despite the Tesla Inc. CEO’s departure in May — and they’re exempt from being furloughed during the government shutdown.
title: White House Keeps 45 DOGE Employees Working Despite Shutdown

author: Helen Nyambura
description: Police in Madagascar barricaded the central business district in Antananarivo, the capital, to block thousands of protesters from accessing a town square that’s been the focal point of past uprising in the Indian Ocean island nation.
title: Madagascar President Faces Pressure to Quit From Gen Z Protests

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukraine’s state-owned giant Naftogaz suffered the largest aerial attack on its gas extraction infrastructure since the start of the war as Russia increased its targeting of the energy sector at the start of the heating season.
title: Russia Ups Strikes on Ukraine Gas Sector at Heating Season Start

description: Mucho después de que se eliminara la mayor parte de la censura política, EE.UU. conservó su poder para prohibir la entrada a extranjeros por sus creencias. Un nuevo caso judicial podría poner a prueba ese poder.
title: De la Guerra Fría a Trump: cómo la negación de visas se volvió una amenaza a los derechos civiles

author: Henrique Almeida
description: Portugal’s Finance Ministry said it will formally present Alvaro Santos Pereira as its new central bank governor on Oct. 6.
title: Portugal to Install Pereira as Central Bank Governor on Oct. 6

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukraine claimed an attack on Russia’s Orsk oil refinery near the border with Kazakhstan, as Kyiv seeks to widen the range of strikes on its foe’s energy infrastructure.
title: Ukraine Claims Attack on Orsk Oil Refinery Deep Inside Russia

author: Zoe Tillman
description: President Donald Trump is exploring options to turn the federal shutdown that began on Oct. 1 into an opportunity to shrink the government workforce. The White House budget office, led by Russell Vought, has urged federal agencies to consider mass layoffs – known as “reductions in force,” or RIFS – arguing that once funding lapses, programs that don’t align with the president’s priorities aren’t required to continue.
title: Why a Legal Fight Is Brewing Over Shutdown Layoffs

author: Simon Marks
description: The United Nations’ food agency will cut the number of Somalis receiving lifesaving emergency aid by more than two-thirds amid a critical funding shortfall.
title: UN Drastically Cuts Somalia Food Aid as US Funding Shortfall Deepens Crisis

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India’s air force chief said it destroyed about a dozen Pakistani aircraft during a confrontation with its western neighbor in early May, offering for the first time a detailed account of Pakistan’s losses in the four-day conflict.
title: India Says It Destroyed US, China-Made Jets in Pakistan Conflict

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court so far has largely accommodated Donald Trump’s assertions of sweeping presidential power. The term that starts Monday will determine just how far the court is willing to go.
title: Trump’s Supreme Court Winning Streak Faces Big Tests Over Presidential Power

author: Ott Ummelas, Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth, Lauren Dezenski
description: The president said it would be “a big insult” to the US if he doesn’t win. Some in Norway fear retaliation if he’s disappointed.
title: Donald Trump and the Aggressive Pursuit of a Nobel Peace Prize

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: Poland’s government plans to offer more local-currency bonds than ever this quarter in a sign of confidence over continued investor demand after the cabinet warned about growing public debt.
title: Poland Plans Record Quarterly Zloty-Bond Sales as Debt Grows

author: John Harney, Jamie Tarabay, Sri Taylor
description: White House Budget Director Russell Vought announced the withholding of more than $2 billion for transportation projects in Chicago, the latest move by the Trump administration to use the shutdown as leverage to shrink the federal government.
title: Trump Halts $2 Billion for Chicago Transit in Shutdown Play

author: Julian Lee
description: Russia’s ability to divert its crude to the global market is diminishing fast as the nation’s oil refineries come under attack from Ukrainian drones.
title: Russia's Spare Oil Export Capacity Running Out as Drones Hit Refineries

author: Arne Delfs, Stephan Kahl
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz on Friday implored Germans to either embrace uncomfortable reforms or watch their economy fade.
title: Merz Urges Germans to Accept Change or Suffer Economic Slide

author: Fiona MacDonald, Peter Martin
description: Gulf nations look increasingly likely to push ahead with US President Donald Trump’s plan for Gaza regardless of whether Hamas accepts it or not.
title: Trump Gulf Allies Aim to Pursue Gaza Plan With or Without Hamas

author: Amanda L Gordon, Laura Nahmias, Bill Allison
description: Billionaires have shelled out record amounts in the mayoral race. Here are the biggest donors.
title: Mamdani, Cuomo PACs Have Millions to Spend as NYC Race Heats Up

author: William Horobin
description: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu pledged to refrain from using a constitutional tool to bypass parliament as he strains to convince lawmakers not to oust him over budget plans.
title: Lecornu Pledges Not to Ram Through French Budget Without Support

author: Souhail Karam
description: A Moroccan youth-led protest movement called on King Mohammed VI to dismiss the government and investigate alleged corruption by the political elite, rejecting the administration’s offer of dialog and reform.
title: Gen Z Protesters Urge Morocco’s King to Dismiss Government

author: Andrea Dudik
description: The populist frontrunner is campaigning for military aid to Kyiv to be curtailed.
title: This Czech Election Carries Unwelcome Fallout for Ukraine

author: Erica Yokoyama, Akemi Terukina
description: Japan’s largest opposition party will push for taxable ¥20,000 ($135) cash handouts to be included in the upcoming extra budget, the party leader said, framing it as a key test of whether deeper cooperation with the ruling coalition is possible.
title: Japan’s Largest Opposition Doesn’t Rule Out LDP Cooperation

author: Marton Eder
description: Shares of Raiffeisen Bank International AG rallied the most in two months on a report the Austrian lender may receive shares in Strabag SE as compensation for damages it was forced to pay in Russia.
title: Raiffeisen Shares Jump on Report EU Proposed Strabag Transfer

author: Patrick Sykes, Ugur Yilmaz
description: Turkey’s energy minister has said buying Russian oil is a commercial decision made by refiners, signaling reluctance to abide by US President Donald Trump’s calls to cut energy ties with Moscow.
title: Turkey Says Russian Oil Purchases Up To Firms Amid Trump’s Call

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: The Dutch Supreme Court has overturned a lower court’s ruling that banned sales of F-35 fighter jet parts from the Netherlands to Israel, ordering the government to reassess the licenses needed for sending the components.
title: Dutch Court Orders Review of Export Ban on F-35 Parts to Israel

author: Christian Wienberg, Sanne Wass
description: Denmark accused Russia of waging a hybrid war against the Nordic nation and warned more attacks are likely, after a series of drone incursions disrupted operations at civilian and military airports.
title: Denmark Says Russia Is Waging Hybrid War After Drone Scare

author: Erik Wasson
description: Democrats are standing firm in the face of President Donald Trump’s threats to leverage the US shutdown to fire thousands of federal workers and extract political revenge, with the two sides locked in a standoff that raises the prospects of lengthy furloughs and a prolonged disruption in government services.
title: Democrats Dismiss Trump Firing Threats as US Shutdown Drags On

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Alberto Brambilla
description: Italy’s parliament approved a motion to conditionally recognize the State of Palestine, amid protests across the country supporting an humanitarian flotilla intercepted by Israel.
title: Italian Lawmakers Approve Conditional Recognition of Palestine

author: Abeer Abu Omar
description: A senior Hamas official said the Palestinian militant group will respond to US President Donald Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza “very soon.”
title: Hamas Says It Will Respond to Trump’s Gaza Plan ‘Very Soon’

author: Jenny Che
description: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu said Friday he would not resort to a controversial constitutional tool to force the budget through the National Assembly.
title: French Premier Won’t Use Constitutional Tool to Force Budget Through

author: Mohammed Alamin, Simon Marks
description: Nearly 2 million people are expected to return to Khartoum by year’s end. They’re finding looted homes, collapsed infrastructure and little aid
title: Rebuilding Khartoum Will Cost Billions That Sudan Doesn’t Have

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: The Philippines’ military chief said he rejected calls by some retired officers for the armed forces to remove President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., amid domestic tensions over the administration’s clampdown on corruption in government.
title: Philippine Military Chief Rejected Calls to Unseat Marcos

description: Russia is attempting to jam UK military satellites on a regular basis, according to the head of UK Space Command.
title: Russia Targeting UK Satellites on 'Weekly' Basis, UK Space Command Boss Says

author: Andrea Dudik
description: Andrej Babis heads into this weekend’s election with promises to grow the economy more quickly and reverse some austerity.
title: Czech Billionaire Channels Trump in Bid to Retake Power

author: William Horobin
description: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu will meet with lawmakers for crunch talks on Friday as he struggles to pass the budget and remain in office.
title: France’s Lecornu Holds Pivotal Talks in Hunt for Budget Allies

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Swiss voters reckon their government is being too amenable to the US after President Donald Trump imposed an outsized tariff on their country’s imports.
title: Switzerland Is Being Too Friendly to the US, Voters Say in Poll

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Thousands of Malaysians rallied outside the US embassy in Kuala Lumpur on Thursday to demand the country take action over Israel, amid growing criticism of US President Donald Trump’s upcoming visit to the Southeast Asian nation.
title: Malaysians Protest at US Embassy Over Israel Before Trump Visit

author: Karthikeyan Sundaram
description: German air traffic control said it suspended flight operations at Munich Airport Thursday evening after several drone sightings, affecting multiple departures and thousands of passengers at the country’s second-biggest hub.
title: German Authorities Suspend Flights at Munich Over Drone Sighting
